channel.title: Club penguin
channel.description: Ok i sometimes go on a game named club penguin (www.clubpenguin.com) somehow could anyone make a private server for it? or could someone tell me how to make a private server for it? It is a flash game and i can get the swf files and any others...they do have a contact page also it is a server game you connect to the servers like runescape

item.title: Club penguin
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Andy89898:

i got that actionscript and put it into notepad and saved it as a java file

Sorry but its clear you don’t know enough to take on this project. Learn a programming language first, Java is fine if you wish, and learn enough ActionScript to make sense of what the client is doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Club penguin
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Use sothink flash decompiler. It’s pretty much the best out there and it couldn’t be more simple. Get a torrent or a serial for the trial.

Also you can’t just grab the swf off the login page. I took a look and it’s a lot different now. Just about everything is split into different swfs. Most actions in the game just make it load another swf file. Look at the action scripting of the loader for a start on getting them, though it might confuse you so here is a website with the current ones: http://recreatecheats.wordpress.com/new-clubpenguin-swfs/

For example, the sled racing game is located at http://media1.clubpenguin.com/play/v2/games/sled/game61.swf

But this isn’t very useful unless you can do what mopman said.

Here is the source for the loader, http://rafb.net/p/vVdoEl59.html (edit: link is dead now :S)-- I suggest you first learn flash action scripting and then every part of the client can be found from there as a start. Particularily of interest to you would be this line:

_loc2.loadClip(MEDIA_FILE_PATH + "" + SHELL_FILE_PATH + "" + SHELL_FILE_NAME + "" + shell_version + ".swf", HOLDER_MC);

Find out the variables and it will lead you to the client.

Read full topic

item.title: Club penguin
item.dc:creator: @adamp40 adamp40
item.description:
@adamp40 wrote:

First you cant rep
Second you cant look at the source.

The only thing i can think of is finding the IP and Port of the real game and connect to it via a telnet session (you might be able to get some stuff from there)
and… Look at the Scripts inside the swf and download all files that might be called in.

Read full topic

item.title: Club penguin
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:8, topic:253619”]In response to your question, you would have to learn a programming language, document the protocol either by analysing traffic or looking at the source for the client (I’m sure there’s a swf decompiler) and then write a server that implements the other side of that protocol. Shouldn’t be hard for such a simple game.

Good luck.[/quote]

Your answer is right there Andy. But by looking at the way you spell my guess is you want to be done in a few hours. From the same fact I also conclude that you’re never going to get far with programming.

Read full topic

item.title: Club penguin
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

In response to your question, you would have to learn a programming language, document the protocol either by analysing traffic or looking at the source for the client (I’m sure there’s a swf decompiler) and then write a server that implements the other side of that protocol. Shouldn’t be hard for such a simple game.

Good luck.

Read full topic
